abstract: The Senate Banking Committee voted to advance Richard Cordray's nomination to lead the new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, although Republicans have vowed to block his confirmation.
snippet: The Senate Banking Committee voted to advance Richard Cordray's nomination to lead the new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, although Republicans have vowed to block his confirmation.
lead_paragraph: The Senate Banking Committee voted along party lines on Thursday to advance Richard Cordray's nomination to lead the new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, although Republicans have vowed to block his confirmation.

headline.main: Consumer Nominee Advances, but Fight Still Looms
